conversation.message: Hello School_E. I’m Student_E. I’m exploring options this round and wanted to learn a bit more about your program and student life. Could you share what you see as School_E’s strongest features and what kinds of students tend to thrive there? I’m keeping School_E in mind as I make my decisions.

Importantly, School_E ranks me #1 in its priority list, so if I apply I will almost certainly be accepted and lock in a guaranteed match. However, applying now would prevent me from pursuing higher true preferences (School_C, School_A, School_D, School_B) where my priority is weaker (C ranks me 4th, A ranks me 5th, D ranks me 4th, B ranks me 4th). Since this is round 1 and I have no history, I should not lock in my worst option yet; instead, I should keep School_E as a safe fallback while I try for better schools in upcoming rounds. Therefore I will TALK to maintain interest without committing.

conversation.message:
Hi Student_E—thanks for reaching out. I’m glad you’re keeping School_E in mind.

School_E’s strongest features are:
1) Strong academic support with high expectations: small classes and structured help (office hours/tutoring) so motivated students can push into advanced work without getting lost.
2) A tight-knit community: students tend to know their teachers well, and we put a lot of emphasis on mentorship and belonging—especially for students who want to grow their confidence.
3) Balance of rigor and student life: we encourage involvement (clubs/activities) alongside academics, and we look for students who are curious, consistent, and willing to engage.

Students who thrive here are typically those who like clear goals, are open to feedback, and want a community where effort is noticed.

To help you evaluate fit: what matters most to you right now—academic challenge, specific subjects (STEM/humanities), extracurriculars, school culture, or support/mentoring? And what kind of environment helps you do your best work?
conversation.thought: Student_E is our top priority. They currently rank us last, so we must persuade and learn what they value to move up their list. Since they are only TALK, we respond with TALK and highlight differentiators plus ask targeted questions, aiming to prompt an APPLY in a future round. Keep tone welcoming and specific; signal strong mutual interest without committing yet.
